Title: Cafeteria Attendant
Entreprise: ATS Automation Tooling Systems Inc.7 reviews
Description:
Job Description


 MAJOR DUTIES:
 Responsible for food preparation and serving of meals in the cafeteria. Assist the Cafeteria Group Lead in maintaining the overall daily operations of the cafeteria.
 SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

Clean and disinfect all high touch surfaces throughout the building daily until the cafeteria is fully operational again.
Daily preparation of food; sandwiches, salad bar, soup, catering orders, baking, etc.
Use and operate cafeteria appliances safely and as required
Serve hot entree lunch to employees, customers and other guests.
Prepare items as requested by customer.
Refill/restock food items throughout the day; salad bar, sandwiches, beverage fridge, snack cart, etc.
Receive payment for food items purchased.
Receive and process in-coming catering orders. Work with the Manager to determine the best method of a catering (i.e. in house, outside vendor, etc.)
Wash dishes as required.
Store silverware as well as coffee/tea mugs and plates after they have been cleaned.
Conduct an inventory review weekly to determine the needs for the following week.
Order food and supplies weekly using the on-line order form. Unpack and store supplies.
Receive in-coming orders from supplier and check against the order made for accuracy.
Maintain coffee stations throughout the building; clean, refill and restock items.
Responsible for the overall cleanliness of the cafeteria.
Prepare and store food in line with the Ministry of Health guidelines and regulations.
Ensure that all business activities are performed with the highest ethical standards and in compliance with the ATS Code of Business Conduct.
Work in compliance with divisional health, safety and environmental procedures.
Refrain from removing or altering safety devices or guarding unless hazardous energies are controlled through lockout-tagout methods.
Report any unsafe conditions, unsafe acts or defects in equipment.





 Additional Information


 QUALIFICATIONS:
 Education:

 Secondary school diploma. Completion of Food Safety Handling Course.

 Experience:

 Two to three years of experience in food services. A background in baking and/or catering is considered an asset.
 Experience with food preparation and presentation
 Knowledge of common safe food handling practices.
 Must have a valid drivers license and use of a vehicle preferred.
 Experience with Microsoft Office; Work, Excel, Outlook preferred.

Title: Research Analyst
Description:
Job Description:
JOB TITLE: Research Analyst
DEPARTMENT: Planning, Building and Economic Development
NUMBER OF POSITIONS: 1
JOB STATUS & DURATION: Temporary/Seasonal
HOURLY RATE: $17.80 per hour
JOB TYPE: Management and Administration
POSTING DATE: May 3, 2022
CLOSING DATE: May 11, 2022
AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY:
Reporting to the Expeditor, this position support research, analysis and data collection for business retention & expansion, investment attraction, marketing and competitive analysis projects that are integral to the Economic Development Offices focus on increasing jobs and investment. The positions primary focus is to assist with the update and maintenance of the business directory. This includes field surveys, phone interviews, research and analysis of business data.
An updated in real time business directory is crucial for:
Spatial and data analysis of business information
Information supporting Planning and Economic Development initiatives
Business outreach and intelligences gathering
B2B connections for current and potential businesses
This position will also help the City facilitate opportunities and gage interest for creating new Business Improvement Areas (BIAs) across the City, so that local businesses leverage their talents and resources to enhance the economic development of an area through promotion, marketing and local improvements
Update the Business Directory database by investigating and contacting local businesses, reviewing internal databases, and online research.
Compile and distribute statistical reports that will include key economic and social performance indicators to assist economic development staff with investment and market enquires.
Assist with the development and maintenance of Site Selection Tool.
Analyze business data to create informative reports.
Liaise with staff from various departments to facilitate information exchange, identify issues and upcoming projects.
Research and benchmark the role of BIAs across the Province and Canada for best practices for operating a BIA and how the municipality can play a role.
Gage interest and solicit feedback from potential BIA participants and identify champions and leaders.
Facilitate information sharing, consultation meetings, presentations, with interested groups.
Create profiles of potential BIAs outlining the characteristics and types of business that might benefit from the creation of a BIA.
Other similar and related duties as assigned.
SELECTION CRITERIA:
EDUCATION:
Completion of 2nd year of Diploma/Degree in Business, Economics, Geography, Environmental Studies, Economic Development or related area of study.
OTHER SKILLS AND ASSETS:
Strong analytical skills
Demonstrated proficiency in applications such as MS Office, Database applications, G.I.S. and website content/authoring tools
Working knowledge of desktop publishing applications
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service.
**Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.
Alternate formats will be provided upon request.
Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.
If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online at: www.brampton.ca/employment by May 11, 2022. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A criminal record search will be required of the successful candidate to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.
As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions. All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable. The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.
Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicants responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.

Title: Administrative Support III
Description:
OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY REGISTRAR
       

Competition No. 22.04.66 




CATEGORY


SALARY


CLOSING DATE







          Full-Time Continuing (35 hours per week)
         

          MSA Band C (Steps 1-8): $21.60 - $31.41 per hour
         

          May 20, 2022
         











About Us

         MacEwan University is where caring faculty help people connect their passions to their future paths. Located in the heart of Edmonton's diverse and dynamic downtown community, and on the traditional lands of Treaty 6 First Nations and homelands of the Metis people, MacEwan is known for exceptional undergraduate learning. With its dedication to teaching excellence, informed by scholarly research, innovation, and creative activity, MacEwan provides an exceptional collaborative and supportive learning environment with a commitment to human rights, environmental sustainability, and opportunities for community engagement. We are committed to creating an equitable, diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community for all peoples, cultures, and identities.
        
 Our comprehensive undergraduate university offers 59 programs to more than 18,000 full- and part-time students in business, communications, community and human services, design, fine and performing arts, health, humanities, natural science, nursing, public safety, and social science. Through a wide array of experiential learning opportunities, and strategic relationships in the community, we partner with others to produce graduates of stature. Along with a robust grounding in their chosen disciplines, MacEwan students are given durable life skills that prepare them to take on the world.
       








Opportunity
 MacEwan University is seeking an enthusiastic and knowledgeable Administrative Support III to assist our Office of the University Registrar (OUR) on a full-time continuing basis.
 The OUR is a complex department with many interconnected parts, and the Administrative Support III will assist with its overall office support and operations. The duties will include direct support for the Registrar and the Associate Registrars for administrative,
 financial and HR-related activities, such as arranging meetings and taking meeting minutes, reconciling office purchases, and arranging interviews for new hires.
 SKILLS
 The successful incumbent will possess:

 excellent verbal and written communication and customer service skills
 excellent organizational and time-management skills
 attention to detail and accuracy
 mature and professional approach to interacting with staff, students, and the general public
 working knowledge and computer proficiency using MS Office applications, Adobe Acrobat Pro, and Google Application Suite
 self-motivated quality with a general technical aptitude to pick up new software/hardware as required
 intermediate computer training, comfortable troubleshooting basic computer and software problems
 working knowledge of PeopleSoft, Campus Solutions, and Finance modules would be an asset
 financial reconciliation of expenses and credit card statements skills
 ability to work with little or no supervision

 QUALIFICATIONS

 Minimum of a post-secondary diploma in office administration or related discipline
 Minimum two years of related office experience, preferably in a post-secondary or adult education environment

 BENEFITS
 When you become part of the MacEwan team, you will enjoy a competitive salary. Our total compensation package includes:

 Competitive base pay
 Generous vacation time
 Secure pension plan
 Flexible benefits package
 Continuous learning culture
 Opportunities for career growth









How to Apply
 To apply, go to https://www.macewan.ca/careers and select the job posting. If you require assistance, please contact us at careers@macewan.ca
 All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.
 This position is included under the MacEwan Staff Association Collective Agreement. Please note, initial salary placement for external candidates is limited to the first five steps of the salary grid.












Diversity Statement

         MacEwan University is committed to fostering the principles of equity, diversity, and inclusion within our community, and we are dedicated to removing barriers that have been historically encountered and are currently experienced by some members of our society. We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized persons, visible minorities, women, persons with disabilities, sexual and gender minorities, and members of all equity-deserving groups. We believe that the diversity of our students, staff, and faculty serve as a strength of our institution and benefit to society. We are committed to ensuring full and inclusive participation for all in our community.
       








Accessibility Statement
 We strive to provide an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, beginning with the hiring process. If you require accommodation, we want to ensure you have the support you need to showcase your abilities. Please contact humanresources@macewan.ca and we will support you to the best of our ability.



 Personal Information Collection Notification
 Personal information is being collected to determine your qualifications for employment. This information is collected, used and protected under the authority of and in accordance with the provisions of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act. It may be provided to non-HR members of a hiring and interview panel if your application advances to that stage of the hiring process. If you have any questions about these arrangements, please contact: Human Resources, University Services Centre, Rm. 10-600, 10700-104 Avenue, Edmonton, Alberta, T5J 4S2 or phone 
         (780) 497-5434.

Title: Sales Execution Associate
Description:
About Us


 Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

 Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

 We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

 We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

 Our brands include: Coca-Cola, Diet Coke, Coca-Cola Zero Sugar, Sprite, Fanta, Barq's, NESTEA, POWERADE, Minute Maid, DASANI and vitaminwater; and our partner brands: Canada Dry, Monster Energy, and A&W.




 About This Opportunity


 Our Sales Execution Associate work in local stores helping our customers keep Coca-Cola products fully stocked and available to ""Refresh the World and Provide Moments of Optimism and Happiness"". Our Coca-Cola SEA is our frontline ambassador bringing happiness and refreshments to consumers in their communities. Would you like to be a Coca-Cola Bottling Ambassador?




 Responsibilities



 Maintain and replenish products in store racks, shelves, displays, and coolers by transporting product between backroom/storage room to front-of-store with manual or powered equipment (pallet jack, hand-truck) ensuring Right Execution Daily meeting company standards for product display
 Building, changing and removing product displays; maintaining product signage; cleaning product space and securing damaged or defective product
 Manage backroom by organizing stock (product); identifying, monitoring, and reporting inventory levels; evaluating and processing damaged product; re-packing product; organizing backroom materials (i.e., pallets, product shells etc.); completing any required paperwork
 Follow all Company and Store policies regarding backroom, display floor, replenishment, equipment, and safety
 Act as an Ambassador by providing customer service to Consumers and store personnel by answering questions, locating product, and providing assistance as needed
 Repetitively lift, carry, and position product (weighing up to 50 lbs or 22 kgs) above shoulder height without assistance
 Ability to push and pull manual and powered equipment (i.e., pallet jack, hand-truck etc.) containing product loads for a minimum of 100 yards without assistance
 Ability to repetitively grasp and manipulate objects of varying size and weight requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination
 Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time





 Qualifications



 Must be 18 years of age and legally eligible to work
 Must have a personal vehicle for use during working hours
 A valid driver's license with a clean driving record with no major violations over the last three (3) years
 Must have current vehicle liability insurance
 1-year exp. working in grocery, retail, warehousing, or related field, preferred Experience working with manual or powered pallet jacks or certification, preferred 1-year experience working under little or no supervisio





 Important


 All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (Coke Canada) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and drivers abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

 Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

 This is what we are all about and we encourage you to learn more! Click Here: The Gibson Way

 Summary This position is responsible for providing administrative and operational support for the Corporate Administration/Facilities group.

 What You'll Be Doing

 Manages first call resolution for all office services and facility management requests through the dedicated AdminLine. Handle more complex office service and facility inquiries in the absence of departmental staff.
 Utilizes corporate ticketing systems for workflow management and tracking.
 Assists with corporate fleet services.

 Demonstrates a personal commitment and proactive approach to Environment, Health & Safety (EH&S) through participation in all applicable EH&S programs and ensures safe operation of the branch, team or unit and compliance with all Company EH&S policies and procedures.
 May perform other duties as assigned.


 What You Will Bring

 High School diploma.
 1+ years office service and/or facility management experience with direct exposure to wireless device management and/or corporate fleet management.
 Administrative Diploma/Certificate or secondary courses would be a definite asset.
 Intermediate knowledge and proficiency of Microsoft Office software programs (Word, Excel, Outlook, Internet Explorer).
 Strong customer service focus and the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff in the organization.
 Ability to work in a team setting.
 Ability to work under pressure in a deadline driven environment.
 Strong oral and written communication skills with proven ability to relate to employees at all levels.
 Good organizational and interpersonal skills.
 Demonstrated attention to detail.


 Working Conditions

 The majority of the work is performed in an office environment.
 Gibson has adopted a hybrid work environment for Calgary-based employees (Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday you're required to work from the Calgary Head Office).
 Must be able to lift 50 lbs.


 Gibson strongly encourages all applicants to be fully vaccinated with the COVID-19 vaccine as soon as the vaccine is available to you as Gibson considers vaccination to be a vital tool in the fight against the pandemic. Gibson may update its vaccination polices/requirements at any time in its sole discretion.

Title: Intermediate Finance Agent - Payrolls
Description:
Description

Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization? If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada's flag carrier.
Air Canada Payrolls is looking for new team members to join our exciting and dynamic team. Are you interested in expanding your skills within an award-winning diverse Company that provides financial support for continued education and provides opportunities to develop your payroll administration skills?
Intermediate Finance Agent
Primary Location
CA-MB-YWG
Band: Not Applicable
The current starting salary is $19.20/hour as per the IAMAW Finance Collective Agreement with possible higher entry wage based on education and experience. Regularly scheduled pay advancements up to $25.51/hour, or higher in the event of promotion or growth into other positions.
Work schedule: Full-time Monday to Friday with flexible start time between 0700am and 1000am, with specific start times designated during training and other operationally required time periods.
Privileges & Benefits
As one of the leading employers in Canada, we like to ensure our employees are well rewarded with a range of benefits including:
Air Canada staff love to travel, and we have one of the most generous employee travel programs in the industry which is available on day one.
We value your wellbeing which is why we offer a wide variety of benefit plans, including health and dental, for you and your family.

Description
Responsible for the accurate and timely payment of monies owing to Air Canada employees while protecting company interests and employee confidentiality:
Perform complex, specialized payroll functions in accordance with clearly defined procedures
Prepare correspondence via email or letter to internal and external stakeholders
Maintain payroll information by collecting, calculating, and entering data
Prepare reports/remittances by compiling summaries of earnings, taxes, deductions, and other payroll related items
Resolve payroll discrepancies by collecting and analyzing information
Provide payroll information by answering questions and requests
Maintain payroll operations by following policies and procedures; reporting needed changes
Maintain employee confidence and protect payroll operations by keeping information confidential
Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed

Qualifications

Qualifications
Minimum two (2) years payroll experience preferred
Completion of the NPI's Payroll Compliance Legislation and Payroll Fundamentals 1 courses and actively pursuing PCP or CPM payroll certification an asset
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Ability to not just multitask but to also anticipate process before directed to do so
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to prioritize duties and use good judgement
Working knowledge of PeopleSoft HR/Payroll will be considered an asset.
Proficiency with PC software Excel, Word and email
Bilingual an asset

Conditions of Employment:
Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.
Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination required

Linguistic Requirements
Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.
Diversity and Inclusion
Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success.
As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.
Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Title: Project Coordinator - Telecommunications
Description:
Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.
               







Description 

Job Summary: Ledcor Technical Services is a leader in providing telecommunication support services across North America. We specialize in providing maintenance, engineering and emergency restoration support to major telecommunication carriers across Canada and the USA.
            
 As a Project Coordinator, you will maintain project systems and procedures including master filing system, project billings, cost accounting, project delivery status and reporting. Utilizing your administrative and customer service skills, you will provide technical and administrative support, including assisting project managers with scheduling, reporting and compliance. You have a thorough knowledge of safety, quality, and scheduling of multiple projects. 
            
 Apply today to join our Technical Services team in Vancouver or Calgary.
            
 Responsibilities

 Demonstrates and promotes a culture of health, safety, and environmental protection on the project by taking an active role in the implementation of the Project Specific Safety Program (PSSP) to achieve compliance of Ledcor HS&E standards, applicable OH&S Acts, regulations, and codes
 Implements, coordinates, and maintains Ledcor systems and procedures in accordance with project specifications and requirements
 Performs general administrative and recordkeeping functions to ensure project specific quality management information is readily available including the completion of required quality documentation
 Ensures subcontractor compliance with Inspection Test Plans, construction drawings and procedures, and other quality documents applicable to the work being performed
 Manages project-related inquiries or escalations and provides appropriate responses in a timely manner
 Tracks project milestones ensuring deliverables are completed and meet project requirements
 Prepares detailed analysis or review of aspects of the project as may be required
 Assist with gathering project requirements from various internal teams
 Overall support of the operational mobilization process


 Qualifications

 Telecommunication experience is an asset
 Fiber optic construction experience (both aerial and underground) is an asset
 2 to 4 years experience in a fast paced administrative or coordinator role
 Proven ability to understand construction administration and contract commercial terms
 Proficient computer skills & knowledge of MS Excel
 Effective communication skills, confident interacting with key contacts at all levels in verbal, written and electronic form
 Good analytical skills, attention to detail and logical problem solver
 Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality and professionalism
 Must be fully vaccinated and provide valid COVID-19 vaccination record (unless you have a legitimate recognized medical or religious reason for not getting vaccinated)


 Work Conditions

 Some travel will be required to site and/or office locations within Canada


 Additional Information:
 Company Description
 Ledcor Technical Services (LTS) designs, builds, and maintains wireline or wireless networks that span North America and beyond. We are a proven leader and innovator in telecommunications network construction, maintenance, and service installation and repair.

 But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!
 Employment Equity
 At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.
 Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

Description:

Horaire Full-Time

Type de Poste Non-Management
   
Situe a distance ? N
   





        Partout au Canada, Delta Hotels propose une selection variee dhotels. Les hotels Delta sont presents dans les villes canadiennes mondialement connues et dans les sites touristiques dexception. Delta Hotels est une enseigne de Marriott International. Elle vous donne la possibilite de trouver un emploi dans le secteur hotelier et de mener une carriere qui vous correspond. Avec plus de 1 100 etablissements en gerance, 19 enseignes et une presence dans plus de 74 pays partout dans le monde, il y a forcement un hotel Marriott International pres de chez vous. Trouvez votre place dans le monde chez Delta Hotels.
       








Resume des fonctions
 Utiliser et entretenir l'equipement et les outils de nettoyage, y compris la machine a laver la vaisselle, les stations de lavage de mains, les stations de lavage de marmites et le compacteur de dechets. Laver et desinfecter la cuisine et la salle d'entreposage, les tables, les outils, les couteaux et les equipements. Recevoir les livraisons, ranger les denrees perissables convenablement et gerer les stocks. S'assurer que les verres et la vaisselle propres sont ranges dans les zones appropriees. Utiliser du detergent, des produits de rincage et des produits chimiques de desinfection dans l'evier a 3 compartiments pour nettoyer la vaisselle. Inspecter, retirer et empiler les articles nettoyes, envoyer les articles souilles au recurage et au lavage. Placer sur les supports et arroser tous les articles sur les supports avec de l'eau chaude afin de detacher et eliminer les residus alimentaires. Trier, tremper et laver/relaver l'argenterie. Vider les bacs de debarrasseur sales. Vider et entretenir les poubelles et la zone autour de la benne a rebuts. Nettoyer et laver a la vadrouille toutes les zones des secteurs assignes. Disposer des verres dans les conteneurs appropries. Desarticuler les boites de carton et les placer ainsi que les autres matieres recyclables dans le bac de recyclage.
 Suivre toutes les politiques et procedures de l'entreprise; signaler les accidents, les blessures et les conditions de travail dangereuses au gestionnaire; et reussir la formation et les certifications de securite. Proteger les actifs de l'entreprise. Parler aux autres en utilisant un langage clair, approprie et professionnel. Developper et maintenir des relations de travail positives avec les autres; soutenir l'equipe afin d'atteindre les objectifs communs. Se conformer aux attentes et aux normes d'assurance qualite. Deplacer, soulever, porter, pousser, tirer et placer des objets pesant jusqua 50 livres (22,7 kg) sans assistance. Se tenir debout, assis ou marcher pendant une periode prolongee ou pour une longue periode de temps. Atteindre les objets au-dessus de la tete et au-dessous des genoux, y compris se plier, faire des rotations du corps, tirer et se baisser. S'acquitter d'autres taches d'emploi raisonnables lorsqu'elles sont demandees par les superviseurs.
Chez Marriott, nous nous engageons a faire passer nos associes en premier et leur sante et leur securite sont nos plus grandes priorites. Ce poste exige que les associes soient entierement vaccines contre le COVID-19 selon les normes actuelles de l'Agence de la sante publique du Canada ou qu'ils beneficient d'un accommodement en matiere de droits de la personne.
 
Marriott International souscrit au principe de legalite dacces a lemploi. Nous sommes attaches a recruter un effectif diversifie et a soutenir une culture inclusive qui donne la priorite aux individus. Nous nous engageons a respecter des principes de non-discrimination envers tous les individus proteges, par exemple les personnes handicapees et les anciens combattants, et envers toute autre base couverte par la legislation applicable.
 
Avis aux candidats: Delta Hotels Quebec prend au serieux sa responsabilite en vertu de la legislation provinciale applicable et elle assurera daccommoder les candidats ayant besoin dadaptation. Si vous avez besoin daccommodement dans le cadre du present affichage de postes ou de votre demande en ligne, veuillez nous joindre au 905-366-5227 ou par courriel au CanadaApplicationAccommodation@marriott.com afin quun membre de notre equipe des ressources humaines puisse repondre a votre demande. Prenez note que ce numero de telephone et cette adresse de courriel ne sont destines quaux personnes necessitant des mesures daccommodement pour postuler sur un emploi.

Title: Operations Officer IV
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

TD Wealth Management takes a sophisticated and holistic goals discovery approach to wealth planning and protection to provide highly personalized advice, solutions and service to clients.
 The Wealth Operations team enable resources for operational needs across the Wealth business resulting in lower costs with excellent customer-service levels. The team facilitate key business strategies to handle core business processes and lead cross operations initiatives while ensuring operational effectiveness. If you want to be a brand ambassador who can help strive efficiencies for the bank, then join our team and make an impactful contribution to TD and your own success.



Job Description


Monitor and review all corporate action notifications and circulars on a daily basis from vendors such as DTC, CDS, TSE, Bloomberg, etc. Manual identification of systems that have share positions. Search for second source information to validate. Determine location of main depository and follow up if corporate action event has not been received to finalize timelines for submission.
 Perform thorough & critical analysis of circulars/notification within tight deadlines. 
Identify potential risk of foreign currency exchange on upcoming corporate action events. 
Identify corporate action events with complex tax treatment and forward to tax department for tax analysis prior to receipt of payment. 
Determine restrictions and eligibility of event for Canadian resident shareholders.
 Determine if any documentation is required and submission timelines to the Agent.
 Analyze information received and break down into condensed form for client's notification.
 Identify important information and conditions to be included to assist the client and reduce risk to the firm. 
For corporate action event review for French preference holders and request translation.
 Co-ordinate mailing with Symcor, send email burst to IA,s and set up for web broker upload. 
Create corporate action files and update on-line logbooks
 Respond to inquiries regarding effective notifications
 Communicate effectively with transfer agents and/or companies to obtain effective confirmed information and other corporate action offering material as required
 Update Database/logbooks as required.
 Ensure Reconciliation system items consistently carry current statuses.
 Escalate problem issues to senior.
 Complete sundry duties and/or assigned daily tasks within agreed upon targets.
 Completes required internal courses and cross-training requirements




Job Requirements


The ideal candidate must have strong written and verbally communication skills
 Must be very good at prioritizing through tight deadlines.
 A self-motivated, detailed oriented and organized individual.
 The candidate should demonstrate sound work ethic, positive attitude, and willingness to learn change and succeed. 
The candidate should be a strong team player as well as work independently with minimum supervision. 
Previous industry experience will be an asset

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. Title: Packaging Warehouse Associate
Description:
Jealous Fruits is the northernmost large scale cherry producer in North America. We grow premium cherries along the shores of Okanagan Lake in the renowned Okanagan Valley of British Columbia, Canada. Our cherries are all hand packed in our state-of-the-art facility, located right on our farm, and shipped to our customers worldwide. 
Job Purpose 
As a Packaging Warehouse Associate, you are responsible for aiding in the receiving, organization, and upkeep of our packaging supplies. You should be someone who has a keen eye for detail and accuracy and be comfortable with the responsibility of keeping an accurate count of our supplies. 
Duties and responsibilities 
Unload trailers and receive packaging, check delivery packing slips match actual product delivered.
Safely organize warehouse by product type.
Distribute packaging product (boxes, bags plastic clamshells etc.) to the packaging line.
Keep our inventory software up to date with received and used product daily.
Inform supervisors if certain product levels are running low.
General maintenance and cleanliness of the storage warehouse & packaging production area. 
Qualifications 
Strong experience operating a Forklift within a warehouse environment (Valid Forklift ticket is an asset but NOT required.)
Be a Canadian Citizen or have a valid Work Permit/Visa.
Comfortable working up to 12 hours a day, 6 days a week.
Have reliable transport to get to work. 
Working conditions 
Our working environment is extremely challenging over a short period of time. Applicants should be aware that this is a farming environment and days off may be limited during our growing and packing season. Applicants should be aware that: 
Work hours are not calendar based, but are dependent on crop maturity and weather (Work hours are generally at least 60+ hours per week)
Environmental conditions can vary from inside to use caution outside, always
Be always aware of working area, as machinery and pallet jacks will be in operation around you.
The candidate must have the ability to work well with people of varying backgrounds and nationalities.
Great teamwork environment. 
Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application. 
Successful applicants must provide acceptable evidence of being fully immunized against COVID-19 (two doses of Health Canada approved COVID-19 vaccine, plus 14 days after your second vaccination) before a start date can be set. 
Job Types: Full-time, SeasonalContract length: 2 months 
Schedule: 
10 hour shift
12 hour shift
8 hour shift

Title: Track Maintenance Specialist
Description:
JOB INFORMATION

Requisition ID: 5723
    
Number of Vacancies: 1
    
Department: Track & Structures (20001107) - Track & Structure Engineering (30000441)
    
Salary Information: $83,246.80 - $104,067.60
    
Pay Scale Group: 9SA
    
Employment Type: Regular
    
Weekly Hours: 35 
    Off Days: Sat, Sun 
    Shift: Day
    
Posted On: May 4, 2022
    
Last Day to Apply: May 18, 2022
    
Reports to: Senior Engineer, Design Standards
   



    The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) is North America's third largest transit system and has been recognized as one of the top places to work in the GTA. Guided by a forward-thinking strategic plan, the TTC's vision is to be a transit system that makes Toronto proud. The TTC's recruitment efforts are directly aligned to its mission of providing "a reliable, efficient, and integrated bus, streetcar and subway system that draws its high standards of customer care from our rich traditions of safety, service and courtesy."
   



General Accountability





       Reporting to the Senior Engineer, this position is responsible for providing track maintenance expertise for investigation and assessment of the condition of the Subway and SRT track network, assist track design engineer in developing solutions to ensure safe, reliable, and efficient track system. This involves performing design reviews of existing track and track components for feasibility of installation and maintainability, providing input into designing and improvement of track components and systems provide expertise in effective and efficient maintenance and construction methodology of track system, inspection, assessment and diagnostics of site conditions and conducting root cause analysis.
      




 Key Job Functions





Providing track maintenance expertise for investigating and assessing the condition of the Subway and SRT track network
Undertaking studies of track maintenance and suggesting methods for improving performance, efficiency, and/or reducing cost
Undertaking studies of problem areas to determine root cause and provide recommendation for corrective action
Reviewing shop drawings and designs, inspecting and approving track materials
Reviewing and inspecting special track work, tangent and curved track, reaction rails, power rails and associated fastener and track support infrastructure
Assisting with the development of track maintenance and maintenance engineering capital and operating budget and scopes
Conducting periodic inspection of Subway and SRT tracks with respect to track switches, rails, power rails, and fasteners
Analyzing work requirements, developing and implementing scheduled rehabilitation and capital projects to ensure all work is prioritized
Assisting engineers in designing and re-engineering of track components and track related construction projects
Participates in the TTC customer service Ambassador Program
Responsible for treating passengers and employees with respect and dignity and ensuring the needs of passengers or employees with disabilities are accommodated and/or addressed (within their area of responsibility) in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Related Orders so that they can fully benefit from the TTC as a service-provider and an employee 





Skills


Demonstrate knowledge of the industry and / or sector 
Demonstrate specialized expertise and knowledge in the assigned field 
Gather information and conduct research 
Maintain documentation and historical records 
Use office technology, software and applications 




Education and Experience





       Completion of a post-secondary college diploma or university degree in a related discipline or a combination of education, training and experience deemed to be equivalent.
      




 Additional Requirements





Sound knowledge of track maintenance principles, methods, practices, and techniques related to track inspection, construction, maintenance, and emergency repair
Must have the ability to read design drawings and the use of spreadsheet application
Must have the ability to carry out feasibility and constructability studies; evaluate alternative proposals; and assess construction and maintenance impacts
Must have the ability to observe and implement TTC safety requirements at work place.
Must be familiar with industry standards such as American Railway Engineering Maintenance Association (AREMA)
Must have or rapidly acquire a comprehensive knowledge of the Ontario Human Rights Code and related Orders including disability accommodation and accessibility requirements pertaining to passenger and employees 





    The TTC is committed to upholding the values of equity, diversity, anti-racism and inclusion in the delivery of its services and in its workplaces. The TTC is committed to fostering a diverse workforce that is representative of the communities it serves at all levels of the organization, and supports an inclusive environment where diverse employee and community perspectives and experiences bring value to the organization. The TTC encourages applications from all applicants, including members of groups with historical and/or current barriers to equity, including but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQ(IA+) community. The TTC values and supports an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment and selection process.
   



    Accommodations for applicants are available upon request throughout the recruitment and selection process, including for those who identify as having a disability. Please contact Human Resources  Talent Management at 
    (416) 393-4570. Any information received related to an accommodation will be addressed confidentially.
   



    The TTCs policy prohibits relatives of current TTC employees from being hired, assigned, transferred or promoted into positions, where there is a conflict of interest due to a relationship. Should you be selected for an interview, you will be required to disclose the name, relationship and position of any relative who is a current TTC employee.
   



    Note: All TTC Employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a precondition of employment in accordance with TTC's Mandatory Vaccination Policy
   



    We thank all applicants for their interest but advise only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Legal Assistant
Description:
Job Information
Job Requisition ID: 25829
Ministry: Environment & Parks
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Regular
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: May 10, 2022
Classification: Subsidiary 01B 3625 Legal Administration 2

About Us

The core business of the Environmental Law Team is to provide legal and strategic services to Alberta Environment and Parks, and the Forestry Division of Alberta Agriculture, Forestry and Rural Economic Development.

Role

The Ministry of Environment & Parks has one Legal Assistant position available with the Environmental Law Team, in Edmonton. This position reports to the Director of the Environmental Law Team, and works with other legal teams in the Legal Services Division of Justice and Solicitor General. Join a supportive team environment that provides challenging work in the legal field.

Duties include, but are not limited to:

Preparing and processing a variety of documents from lawyers written or verbal instructions, including memos, letters, agreements and reports.
Working with clients to coordinate Ministerial Orders, Orders in Council and other documents as needed
Coordinating and managing action requests in ARTS
Liaising with Legal Services Division legal teams to coordinate processes and procedures (e.g., arrange for information technology and software updates)
Maintaining and organizing filing system
Preparing, maintaining and tracking records and correspondence for appeals before administrative tribunals
Assisting lawyers with hearings/mediations
Accurately creating and completing all forms of correspondence and communication
Assisting several lawyers, as well as working with other Legal Assistants in a team environment
Performing other duties, as required
To be successful in this role, you must possess strong interpersonal skills and act in a responsible, professional manner. Your strong communication skills are essential to respond to questions and provide information to government officials, administrative tribunal staff and members of the public. The successful candidate will work well in a team environment, shift priorities with little or no notice and be able to handle high volumes of work efficiently and in a timely manner.
Must possess proficiency with:
Microsoft 365 (Teams, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access)
Adobe Acrobat
Qualifications

Two year diploma in a related field such as Legal Assistant or Paralegal plus one year of progressively responsible related experience
Experience in a legal environment specializing in civil law is preferred.
Equivalency: Directly related education or experience considered on the basis of: 1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or 1 year of experience for 1 year of education

Assets:
Knowledge of and experience with various search and legal research (e.g., eCarswell, CanLii) tools
Experience in ARTS, 1GX, ProLaw

Candidates with lesser qualifications may be considered at a lower classification and salary.

APS Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reaching our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in-depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.


The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:

In this role, you will contribute to our team by demonstrating the following behavioral competencies:
Build Collaborative Environments  Encourages diversity, promotes collaboration and positive relationships (even in challenging circumstances) within and across groups and build commitment to reach desired results
Drive for Results  Plans for results, sets goals and prioritizes work to accomplish them. Follows through on duties and tasks and reports on progress.
Systems Thinking  Seeks clarity, identifies several analytical techniques and sources of knowledge to break apart complex problems.
Agility  Sees out new opportunities, identifies alternative approaches or courses of action in unclear and complex situations. Able to anticipate, assess, and readily adapt to changing priorities, manage resilience in times of uncertainty and effectively work in a changing environment.
Other Relevant Attributes  ability to navigate high-volume, fast-paced workloads; capacity to manage tight and coinciding timelines.
Salary

$2,017.62 - $2,480.72 Bi-weekly (approximately $52,659 - $64,746 per year)

Notes

These positions work Monday to Friday, 8:15 AM-4:30 PM, 36.25 hours a week.
In your resume, please include dates (including months and years) associated with all education and work experience. Also, please indicate whether your work experience is casual, part-time or full-time. For example January 15, 2006 - June 25, 2009: Assistant (PT three 8 hrs shifts/week).
This position will require final candidates to undergo a security clearance.

What we offer:

Working for the Alberta Public Service 
Pension plans:
Public Service Pension Plan (PSPP) 
Leadership and mentorship programs
Professional learning and development
Positive workplace culture and work-life balance
How To Apply
If you are not currently an employee with the Government of Alberta, the first step in applying for a job is creating your candidate profile within our online application system,
Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.
Once you have created your candidate profile, visit the Alberta Public Service job site to apply for jobs at
Tips for applicants:
It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)

Closing Statement

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.
We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.
If you require any further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, please contact Samantha Kith at samantha.kith@gov.ab.ca.

Title: Plant Operator - Albian Operations Plant Froth
Description:
Plant Operator - Albian Operations Plant Froth
 - (2210737)
The Opportunity:
We have an amazing opportunity for a Plant Operator to join our Albian Plant Operations Team. As a Plant Operator, you will interact and coordinate with a team of operators and maintenance staff to ensure that production, quality and environmental targets are met for our operations. The key functions of a Plant Operator are to contribute to the reliability and safe operations of our facility and to work with many key internal and external stake holders. This position reports to the Shift Team Lead.
Key Accountabilities:
Utilize your operations expertise in a dynamic production environment, maintain and optimize equipment and processes
Ensuring Environment, Health & Safety and integrity are a top priority, and completing all work with a safety conscious attitude
Issuing Safe Work Permits within a complex hydrocarbon operating environment, including hot work, work within confined spaces, and excavation/trenching work
Safe isolation of process equipment including; the development of specific equipment Lock Out Tag Outs (LOTOs), placing and verifying isolations, and blinding
Performing operating assignments on plant equipment to ensure a safe working environment
Troubleshoot equipment issues and perform area maintenance activities and housekeeping including; Blinding, Valve and pump replacements and operating mobile equipment
Review, understand and fully utilize Canadian Naturals safety and operational procedures and standards in performing all facets of work
Recommending modifications to plant processes where performance can be improved. Work with the various teams on preventative maintenance and ensure equipment is running efficiently and safely
Utilize our maintenance management system and enter work orders for deficiencies that need to be repaired
Monitor facility readings, perform proactive equipment monitoring rounds and sample collections
Participate in review, modifications or development of facility procedures
Start-up, operate and shut down unit operations with expertise
Ensure all safety documentation is completed for all personnel working in the facility under operations care
Identify and scope out Continuous Improvement opportunities to maximize production, minimize operating costs and eliminate downtime
Maintain proper documentation on a shift-by-shift basis including operating logs, Intelletrac, maintenance records and safety & environmental reports
Provide training on operating policies and procedures

Other Details:
Job location: Albian Oil Sands - Fort McMurray, Alberta
Eligible for relocation pursuant to Canadian Naturals Relocation Regular Policy
Company sponsored Fly-In/Fly-Out from Calgary or Edmonton OR bussing from Fort McMurray
Competitive salary, stock options, stock savings plan and benefits
This is a safety sensitive position
Shift schedule: 7 days on, 7 off, 7 nights on, 7 off - (Tuesday to Monday)
This is a hands-on role. Physical requirements may include climbing stairs and ladders, entering vessels and equipment for inspections, turning valves, dragging hoses, long hours on your feet etc.

Skills & Qualifications:
5 years of Operational or Tradesman work with Hydrocarbon experience at a large integrated industrial facility with a minimum Grade 12 or GED is required
4th Class Power Engineering Ticket and/or Journeyman Certification and/or a Technology Diploma is an asset
Valid Class 5 Drivers License
Self-starter that works well in a high paced team environment with a continuous improvement mindset
Ability to work in an outside environment, at heights, climbing ladders and work in and around confined spaces

Why Canadian Natural?
CANADIAN NATURAL is a senior independent crude oil and natural gas exploration, development and production company based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Our strong, diversified asset base is comprised of a balanced portfolio of light, synthetic, and heavy crude oil and natural gas. Canadian Natural operates in Canada, the United Kingdom and Offshore Africa.
At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." We are committed to a long-term presence in the communities where we operate. Our activities create value by providing employment, business development opportunities, revenues to governments that contribute to spending on goods and services, and essential resources for public services, including health, safety, education and training.
Over the last 30 years, we have grown from a Company with nine employees to over 10,000 employees. We have increased our production from approximately 400 BOE/d in 1989 to more than one million BOE/d today.
Safety is a core value at Canadian Natural. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment
Canadian Natural Resources Limited  Canadian Natural - is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.
Application deadline is May 10, 2022. Apply now!
.

Primary Location Fort McMurray

Title: Server

Server
Servers lead the Guest Experience at the table and ensure our Guests have everything they need from appitizers to desserts. Why Is BP A Great Place To Work?

Driven by professional development opportunities, and is consistently seeking new learning and skill-building moments
Boston Pizza was established over 50 years ago and is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's 50 Top Managed Companies for over 20 years in a row. We are committed to the development & growth of our team members, integrity, philanthropy and innovation. If you love working with people in a team environment and believe in exceeding the expectations of Guests daily, Boston Pizza is the place for you!

Title: FINANCIAL ANALYST
Entreprise: Ministry of Children, Community and Social Services44 reviews
Description:
Are you looking for a new opportunity to use your knowledge and experience in accounting and financial administration? Bring your expertise to the Ministry of Children, Community and Social Services where, as a part of a remote team, you will provide advice to program managers on budgets and accounts, and support efficient and effective financial and administrative practices for the delivery of the ministry's social assistance programs.
   
 The successful candidates can work from one of our regional office locations below. In your application, please indicate which location(s) you are applying to.
   

1055 Princess Street, Kingston
17310 Yonge Street, Newmarket
217 York Street, London
70 Foster Drive, Sault Ste. Marie
199 Larch Street, Sudbury
621 Main Street West, North Bay

 What can I expect to do in this role? You will:
   

provide financial analysis and support to a breadth of and transfer payment agencies including Municipalities, First Nations and francophone organizations
prepare, analyze and monitor reports on expenditure/revenue accounts to support the effective financial management of Social Assistance Programs
develop financial systems and processes to enhance accountability and promote efficiency 
ensure compliance with ministry policy and legislation
advise on budget controls, accounting transactions, accrual accounting, financial coding, and generally on accounting policies and procedures
assist in the planning and preparation of financial forecasts, business cases and financial reports
assist in the preparation of presentations to senior management
provide guidance, direction, and training on policies to ministry staff and transfer payment agencies using an array of communication methods (e.g. in person, by phone/video conference)

 How do I qualify?
 Knowledge of Accounting and Financial Administration

You have knowledge of general accounting principles and practices (GAAP), including accrual accounting practices. 
You can advise program areas on accrual accounting rules and monitor and analyze expenditure accounts/financial statements related to program areas and transfer payment agencies. 
You have mathematical skills to prepare financial forecasts/analysis, make payments, reconcile financial statements and transfer payment budgets. 
You have knowledge of financial information systems and common software applications to monitor accounts, analyze financial data, and prepare reports. 
You are able to interpret and apply recognized accounting and financial analysis methods, legislation, policies and procedures to meet financial requirements. 
You have an understanding of central agency roles, policies and requirements.

 Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills

You have analytical and research skills to assess efficiency of business practices, financial controls, internal audit procedures, and to review financial and program related information. 
You have problem solving skills to identify emerging issues and make recommendations for change.

 Communication and Consultation Skills

You have communication skills to advise program managers and stakeholders on accounting matters and prepare a variety of financial reports and correspondence. 
You have consultation skills to obtain information, provide advice on financial positions, identify courses of action, and resolve issues. 
You have presentation skills to provide training on Ministry policies, guidelines and processes related to financial administration.

Title: Track Maintainer
Description:
Rail systems must do one thing above all: run. With modern maintenance solutions  from diagnostics to data-based action recommendations, from quick delivery of replacement parts to strategically planned modernization  we ensure your systems' highest reliability and availability: 100% Railability.

 For us, good service means that we are there for our partners and customers when they need us  and even beyond. That is because we define ourselves by what we do. Every day, every hour, every minute. We help our customers move the world.
 Per our customer requirements, we seek to immediately hire multiple Track Maintainers for the Toronto area - we'd love to have you join our growing team!
 Responsibilities:

Performs mainly pre-defined, technical tasks (for example, basic commissioning of products and systems, integration of components to a system, basic engineering, maintenance jobs) and work packages on-site and remotely.
Supports customer remotely and onsite, and provides 2nd and 3rd level user support in case of arising issues.
Coordinates and accomplishes defined service operations and/or resolves product issues for customers equipment.
Supports in generating sales leads for pre-defined service offers and contributes to planning activities.
Adheres to defined processes and applicable regulations.

 Requirements:

Previous experience with constructing track
Willingness and ability to work both day and evening shifts


 Change the future with us.
 We are looking for dedicated and talented people who tackle ever-changing challenges, customer needs, and questions from colleagues with clever concepts and creativity. We embrace change and work with curious minds re-inventing the future of work. Join us and let us focus together on whats truly important: making lives better with new ideas and the latest technology around the world.
 Why youll love working for Siemens!

Freedom and a healthy work- life balance Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.

Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!
Employee perks and discounts.
Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Title: Receptionist (12-month contract)
Description:
At McCarthy Tetrault, we offer challenging and rewarding career opportunities and are delighted to have been selected for the tenth consecutive year in 2022 as one of Canadas Top 100 Employers and one of Canadas Best Diversity Employers. Our culture is built on professional excellence, collaboration, innovation, thought leadership and entrepreneurialism. We embrace inclusion in all its forms and we provide the tools and opportunities to help our people develop to their full potential.
Schedule: Monday - Friday from 7:30 am to 4:00 pm MST
As a Receptionist, you will be:

Working collaboratively with other members of the team to assist in the coordination of all aspects of client and internal events.
Liaising regularly with the Conference Services Team on items pertaining to the operation of the Conference Floor including room set-up, event panning and logistics.
Greeting and screening all visitors in a prompt, courteous and professional manner.
Answering incoming calls and emails promptly and professionally and directing them to the appropriate individual.
Logging and processing incoming and outgoing mail and deliveries that pass through Conference Services.
Reporting all security matters to management, as well as reporting any areas requiring repairs or maintenance to the appropriate personnel.
Providing assistance during special events organized by the firm.
Other duties as assigned.

Records Management

Processing requests for new files.
Maintaining inventory and preparing files, boxes and interfiling to and from offsite storage.
Handling the transfer of files to and from law firms and clients.
Updating the records management system accurately, ensuring the integrity of the information.
Generating activity reports, including monthly workflow reports.

As our ideal candidate, you will have:

Minimum of High School Diploma.
Minimum 3 years of related experience preferably in a professional hospitality environment.
Professional certification in Hospitality or in Records management is an asset.
Strong written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable communicating with internal stakeholders and external vendors.
Strong attention to detail with excellent spelling, grammar, and proofreading skills.
Exceptional interpersonal skills and customer focus.
Strong professional demeanor and an approachable disposition.
Demonstrated ability to ensure utmost discretion and confidentiality at all times.
Excellent time management, organizational and multi-tasking skills. Ability to work under pressure to meet critical deadlines, with a strict attention to detail.
Ability to deal effectively with challenging situations and demonstrated effective problem-solving skills.
Frequent bending and lifting (up to approximately 50 lbs) required.

As a member of the McCarthy team, you will have access to:

Outstanding benefits from day one, including insurance premiums paid by the Firm.
Competitive compensation including paid overtime.
A commitment to professional development and growth opportunities for our people at all levels, supported by a culture that fully embraces and encourages two-way feedback.
Strong community involvement and a commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.
A collaborative, cohesive culture that connects lawyers and business teams through collective purpose.

How to apply:

   We invite you to submit your application to careers@mccarthy.ca. We thank all applicants for their interest in McCarthy Tetrault; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. We regret that we are unable to respond to individual inquiries about application status. McCarthy Tetrault is an equal opportunity employer that fosters an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment. Please notify us if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.

Title: Enterprise Business Systems Analyst (1-Year Contract)
Description:
The Town of Miltons Corporate Services Department is accepting applications for the 1 year contract position of Enterprise Business Systems Analyst. Reporting to the Manager, Data Architecture & Application Services, this position is responsible for performing system administration, support and maintenance, as well as understanding client business processes to design and implement technical requirements, configurations, and solutions for the Towns ERP Financial Accounting & Procurement system, Taxation, Budgeting, Building Permit & Licensing and Parking Enforcement enterprise business systems. This role will serve as the subject matter expert for technical solutions, coordinating and interacting with key stakeholders such as business experts, system administrators, developers and solution vendors. It will employ Information Technology Project Management methodologies to manage supported applications and implementation life cycles.


 Key Responsibilities
 Operational Management

Administer and support the day to day I.T. operations (issue management) of the Towns ERP Financial Accounting & Procurement system, Taxation, Budgeting, Building Permit & Licensing and Parking Enforcement enterprise business systems
Responsible for defining application system and data processing needs
Oversee test plans and testing standards or procedures; as well as test script creation and execution during application implementation or upgrades
Identify and implement system improvement and business automation opportunities involving the development of custom reports, forms, queries, scripts or data extraction
Participate in application upgrades, implementation, integration and testing
Participation in on-call after hours support rotation for key business systems and applications

Acquisition and Deployment

Act as the technical lead in the deployment of enterprise application enhancements and new modules; communicate regularly and maintain pro-active relationships with stakeholders for day-to-day business system support purposes
Translate complex business requirements and business processes into relevant functional and technical specifications

Application Planning

Responsible for conducting quality assurance reviews on existing enterprise systems throughout the software development lifecycle
Provide technical input during the planning, execution and management of application integrations
Provide input in the Towns enterprise application capacity plans and review growth forecast to ensure that the enterprise application infrastructure continues to meet the growing needs of Town staff and citizens



 Education and Experience

Post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field.
Demonstrated ability to utilize SQL Plus, PL/SQL, Power BI, JasperReports, Crystal Reports, SSRS for data extraction and custom report creation
Knowledge of and demonstrated ability to work with HTML, Javascript, jQuery and web browser developer tools to assist with application testing and troubleshooting
Knowledge of Oracle Database 11g and above using SQL Plus, PL/SQL and Oracle Fusion Middleware
Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies
Minimum of 3 years experience working with and supporting Oracle and SQL Server based enterprise business applications
Previous Municipal experience supporting any of the following enterprise applications considered an asset: CMiC Financials, AMANDA, FMW, gTechna, VTAX Taxation system
Courses in relational databases, SQL Plus, PL/SQL, multi-tier application management or data analytics
Highly self-motivated & directed, with a keen attention to detail
Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service



 Salary Range: $75,883 - $94,854

Title: Web, Project Manager (Freelance)
Description:
Overview: 
  
    "Youve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and were committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.
  


 When you join KPMG youll be one of over 227,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 146 countries.
  


 With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, theres no limit to the impact you can make. Lets do this."
  


 Job Overview:
  


 To enable business growth and innovation, the Web Project Manager will oversee the development of web projects from the inception stage to the online deployment. Reporting to the Director of Sales Enablement, the candidate will work with Sales and Account teams to define the scope, strategy and lead the development of bespoke websites for targeted client initiatives.
  

    The ideal candidate will demonstrate attention to detail, an ability to provide a high level of service to internal clients and strong relationships with internal and external vendors.
   What you will do: 
  
Consult with internal stakeholders to understand project requirements and scope, discuss strategy and approach.
 Work with the website development team to propose the site wireframe, appearance, and functionalities, focusing on developing a client-centric, on-brand, and visually appealing interface.
 Define roles and responsibilities, build and maintain the project plan, risk and issues log, resource plan and budget.
 Plan website reviews with the internal clients, ensure final testing and review before deployment.
 Ensure projects are delivered to the agreed time, cost and quality and responsible for addressing issues with internal stakeholders and suppliers when these are not met.
 Provide regular status updates and website analytics to the lead partner and other stakeholders
 Deliver training to new site collaborators.
 Keeping abreast of developments and trends in website design and development.
 
 What you bring to this role: 
  
Minimum of 3 years of experience in web project management. PMP would be considered an asset.
 University degree or college diploma in project management.
 Experience working on Zoomforth or similar platform an asset.
 Solid experience in delivered digital projects through a full lifecycle and Agile methodology
 Experience working with offshore third-party providers
 Knowledge of advancements and trends in web design and development.
 Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
 Strong leadership, collaboration, and communication skills.


    #li-remote

 Integrity, we do what is right |

   For Better, we do what matters

KPMG will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.
